mcq.question: When was Anushilan Samiti founded?
mcq.explanation: Anushilan Samiti was founded in 1902 in Bengal by Promotha Mitter and others.

mcq.question: Who were founders of Anushilan Samiti?
options: Promotha Mitter, Jatindranath Banerjee, Barindra Kumar Ghosh
mcq.explanation: Anushilan Samiti was founded by Promotha Mitter and others including Jatindranath Banerjee and Barindra Kumar Ghosh.

mcq.question: Anushilan Samiti published which journals?
mcq.explanation: Anushilan Samiti published journals Yugantar and Sandhya Prakash.

mcq.question: Who attempted on Sir Fuller's life (1907)?
mcq.explanation: An attempt by Yugantar on Sir Fuller, Lt. Governor of Eastern Bengal and Assam (1907); Fuller eventually resigned.

mcq.question: Who attempted to kill Muzaffarpur Magistrate (1908)?
mcq.explanation: Prafulla Chaki and Khudiram Bose attempted to kill Muzaffarpur Magistrate Kingsford in 1908.

mcq.question: Alipore Conspiracy Case - who was acquitted?
mcq.explanation: Aurobindo Ghosh was acquitted in the Alipore Conspiracy Case (1908).

mcq.question: What happened to Khudiram Bose?
mcq.explanation: Khudiram Bose was hanged for the Muzaffarpur/Alipore Conspiracy Case attempt.

mcq.question: Who led Delhi Conspiracy Case (1912)?
options: Rash Behari Bose and Sachindra Sanyal
mcq.explanation: Rash Behari Bose and Sachindra Sanyal led the Delhi Conspiracy Case (1912) to assassinate Viceroy Hardinge.

mcq.question: German Plot (1916-17) was led by?
mcq.explanation: German Plot/Zimmerman Plan (1916-17) was led by Jatindranath Mukherjee (Bagha Jatin) and Yugantar in Bengal.

mcq.question: Who organized Ramosi Peasant Force (1879)?
mcq.explanation: Ramosi Peasant Force (1879) in Maharashtra was organised by Vasudev Balwant Phadke.

mcq.question: Chapekar Brothers assassinated whom (1897)?
options: Plague Commissioner Rand and Lt. Ayerst
mcq.explanation: Chapekar Brothers (Damodar and Balkrishna) assassinated Plague Commissioner Rand and Lt. Ayerst (1897).

mcq.question: Who founded Mitra Mela (1899)?
mcq.explanation: Mitra Mela (1899) in Maharashtra was founded by V.D. Savarkar and his brother.

mcq.question: Mitra Mela merged with which organization?
mcq.explanation: Mitra Mela merged with Abhinav Bharat in 1904.

mcq.question: Who killed District Magistrate Jackson (1909)?
mcq.explanation: Anant Lakshman Kanhere killed District Magistrate A.M.T. Jackson in Nashik (1909).

mcq.question: Who assassinated Robert Asch (1911)?
mcq.explanation: Vanchi Iyer assassinated Robert Asch, District Collector of Tirunelveli, Madras (1911).

mcq.question: Who founded India House (1905)?
mcq.explanation: Bharat Swashashan Samiti/India House (1905) in London was founded by Shyamji Krishnavarma.

mcq.question: India House published which journal?
mcq.explanation: Key figures like Savarkar and Hardayal published The Indian Sociologist from India House.

mcq.question: Who assassinated Curzon-Wyllie (1909)?
mcq.explanation: Madanlal Dhingra assassinated Curzon-Wyllie in London (1909), protesting British rule.

mcq.question: When was Ghadar Party founded?
mcq.explanation: Ghadar Party was founded in 1913 in San Francisco, North America.

mcq.question: Who founded Ghadar Party? (UPSC 2022)
options: Sohan Singh Bhakna, Lala Hardayal, Ramchandra, Bhawan Singh, Kartar Singh Sarabha, Barkatullah, Bhai Premchand
mcq.explanation: Ghadar Party (1913) founded by Sohan Singh Bhakna, Lala Hardayal, Ramchandra, Bhawan Singh, Kartar Singh Sarabha, Barkatullah, and Bhai Premchand (UPSC 2022).

mcq.question: Ghadar Party aimed at?
options: Sparking all-India uprising with German support during WWI
mcq.explanation: Ghadar Party aimed at sparking all-India uprising with support from Germany during WWI (UPSC 2022).

mcq.question: When was Berlin Committee formed?
mcq.explanation: Berlin Committee for Indian Independence was formed in 1915 in Berlin, Germany.

mcq.question: Who led Berlin Committee?
options: Virendranath Chattopadhyaya, Bhupendranath Dutta, Lala Hardayal
mcq.explanation: Berlin Committee was led by Virendranath Chattopadhyaya, Bhupendranath Dutta, and Lala Hardayal with German support.

mcq.question: When was Singapore Mutiny?
mcq.explanation: Singapore Mutiny occurred on February 15, 1915.

mcq.question: Singapore Mutiny involved which units?
mcq.explanation: Singapore Mutiny (1915) involved 5th Light Infantry and 36th Sikh Battalion, led by Jamadar Chisti Khan, Jamadar Abdul Gani, and Subedar Daud Khan.

comprehensive.question: Trace the evolution of revolutionary activities in Bengal from Anushilan Samiti (1902) through various conspiracies to the German Plot (1916-17), analyzing methods and outcomes.
comprehensive.answer: Anushilan Samiti (1902): Founded by Promotha Mitter, Jatindranath Banerjee, Barindra Kumar Ghosh. Published Yugantar and Sandhya Prakash journals. Advocated revolutionary activities like Swadeshi Dacoities, physical training, moral education.

comprehensive.question: Analyze the international dimension of revolutionary activities through India House (1905), Ghadar Party (1913), Berlin Committee (1915), and various missions, examining how revolutionaries sought external support.
comprehensive.answer: India House London (1905): Founded by Shyamji Krishnavarma as revolutionary hub for Indian nationalists. Key figures: Savarkar, Hardayal published The Indian Sociologist. Inspired revolutionaries in Paris, Geneva, London.

comprehensive.question: Compare revolutionary activities across regions (Bengal, Maharashtra, Punjab, Madras) and London/international centers, analyzing regional characteristics and their contribution to overall movement.
comprehensive.answer: Bengal - Most Organized: Anushilan Samiti (1902): Foundational organization with journals, physical training, dacoities. Multiple cases: Fuller attempt (1907), Muzaffarpur (1908), Alipore Conspiracy (1908), Barrah Dacoity (1908), Delhi Conspiracy (1912), German Plot (1916-17).
